title: The Mysterious dog
description: growing number of schools across the UK are bringing dogs into the classroom to support learning, particularly reading. Yes, dogs!  In fact as early as 1999 an American organization called Intermountain Therapy Animals used dogs to support children’s reading and since  then international interest has grown and there are now a number of initiatives around the world, including The Bark and Read Foundation in the UK.But is this a quaint idea or does it have real merit and be worthy of more schools taking it seriously.One of the main reasons there is growing interest in such initiatives is because of widespread concerns over children’s standards of reading, as indicated by the (PISA) results. In 2016, the UK ranks 21st, below many other European countries, and our average point score fell from 499 to 498 in three years. Although PISA attracts critics, few would deny that around the UK many children lack motivation and enjoyment when reading and this has an impact on their achievement.  Yet the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development found that students who enjoyed reading the most performed significantly better than those who said that they enjoyed reading the least - over a third stated that they gained no enjoyment from books. Enjoyment of reading is a stronger predictor of success than socio-economic background (Clark and De Zoysa, 2011). The various reading programmes that use dogs share the principle that reading should be enjoyable. Dogs may provide an incentive for those children reluctant to pick up a book. Why? Well, the dog is a non-judgmental listener, whose very presence may calm and relax reluctant and anxious readers. Well-trained reading dogs make for a patient audience. Dew (2000:199) suggests that the dog brings a nonverbal but collaborative language to the classroom – the dog ‘never expresses himself or his wisdom verbally, but he can speak volumes nonverbally’.Of course, not everyone likes dogs and it is important to teach children how to behave safely around them. Young children frequently misunderstand body language. Bringing a well-trained and assessed dog into school in a controlled manner can help all children learn how to safely meet, greet and respect these animals.

title: Murder in Dhaka
description: On the night of January 15th, 2023, police were called to a residence in the suburbs of Dhaka Bangladesh, where they found the body of 34-year-old John Doe. The victim had been brutally stabbed multiple times, and there were signs of a struggle throughout the house.Upon arriving at the scene, police immediately began their investigation. They collected evidence, took statements from witnesses, and canvassed the neighborhood for anyone who may have seen or heard anything suspicious.According to witnesses, the victim had been hosting a dinner party at his home earlier in the evening. Several guests reported that there had been an altercation between the victim and another party-goer, identified as 25-year-old Jane Smith. Smith had left the party shortly before the murder took place, and she was later arrested and charged with the crime.The prosecution's case against Smith is based on several key pieces of evidence. A bloody knife found at the scene of the crime has been linked to Smith through DNA analysis, and witnesses reported hearing her and the victim arguing loudly before the murder took place. Additionally, several guests reported seeing Smith leave the party in a hurry shortly before the murder occurred.The defense, however, has argued that the evidence against Smith is circumstantial and that there are inconsistencies in the prosecution's case. They have pointed out that several other guests at the party had motive to commit the murder and that there is no concrete evidence linking Smith to the crime.The trial is ongoing, and a verdict is expected to be reached within the next few weeks. The case has garnered widespread media attention, and the public is closely following the proceedings.This murder case highlights the importance of thorough and unbiased investigation in bringing justice for the victim and his loved ones. It also serves as a reminder of the complexities and nuances of criminal cases, where evidence and testimony must be carefully examined and evaluated in order to reach a fair and just decision.

description: In partnership with Sydney startup Trace, Envato is delivering on its sustainability promise as a B-Corp and meeting part of its recent commitment to the To Whom It Should Concern campaign. description: Suicide is a serious public health issue that affects people of all ages and backgrounds. According to the World Health Organization, suicide is the second leading cause of death among 15-29 year-olds globally. It is a complex issue with multiple causes, and it is important to raise awareness about suicide and its prevention.One of the main causes of suicide is mental health issues such as depression, anxiety, and PTSD. These conditions can lead to feelings of hopelessness, helplessness, and worthlessness, which can make suicide seem like the only option. Other factors that can contribute to suicide include substance abuse, financial stress, relationship problems, and traumatic life events.It's important to recognize the warning signs of suicide and to take them seriously. These signs can include talking about wanting to die, talking about feeling hopeless or having no purpose, increasing alcohol or drug use, and withdrawing from friends, family, and activities.Preventing suicide requires a multifaceted approach that addresses the underlying causes of suicide, including mental health and substance abuse issues. This approach should include education, early identification and treatment of mental health conditions, and support for those who have lost someone to suicide.One of the most important steps in preventing suicide is to reach out for help if you or someone you know is struggling. This can be done by talking to a trusted friend or family member, seeking help from a mental health professional, or calling a suicide prevention hotline.It's important to remember that suicide is preventable and that help is available. By raising awareness about suicide and its prevention, we can work together to save lives. If you or someone you know is in crisis, please reach out for help.Here are some helplines that you can contact if you or someone you know needs help:Suicide is a complex issue with multiple causes and it's important to raise awareness about it and its prevention. description: Winter is a season that brings a unique set of challenges and opportunities. As the days get shorter and the temperatures drop, it's important to be prepared for the colder weather and the potential hazards it can bring.One of the most significant hazards of winter is the risk of hypothermia and frostbite. These conditions occur when the body loses heat faster than it can produce it, and they can be life-threatening if not treated quickly. To prevent hypothermia and frostbite, it's important to dress in warm layers, protect exposed skin, and to pay attention to weather forecast and wind chill.Another hazard of winter is the risk of accidents on the road. Snow and ice can make for slippery driving conditions, and it's important to drive carefully, reduce speed, and keep a safe distance from other vehicles. It's also important to equip your vehicle with snow tires, chains, and a winter emergency kit.Winter also brings the opportunity for outdoor activities such as skiing, snowboarding, ice skating, and snowshoeing. These activities can be a great way to stay active and enjoy the winter weather, but they also come with their own set of hazards. It's important to be aware of the risks and take proper safety precautions when participating in these activities.Winter also can bring some other challenges, such as power outages, due to storms or heavy snowfall, and a harder time to travel, and to get groceries, it's important to have a plan for these situations and to be prepared with emergency supplies.Despite the challenges, winter can also be a beautiful and enjoyable season. Whether you're cozying up by the fire or hitting the slopes, there are plenty of ways to make the most of the winter months.In conclusion, Winter can bring hazards, but also many opportunities and beautiful moments, it's important to be prepared for the colder weather, and the potential hazards that it can bring, and enjoy the winter season safely.
